ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4-8 hours
5-6 hours
About 2-3 hours of reading

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course is effective at teaching comparative health systems.
Really fun class Great discussions Chima is very knowledgeable and engaging

I learned a lot from this course. Class was always interesting and I loved that Chima applied relevant issues, such as the growing refugee crisis, to the curriculum. I feel that I know so much more about health systems than I did before and am so happy I took this class, I think what I learned will be valuable throughout my career.

Great groundwork for understanding healthcare systems around the world and applying methodology to understanding their formation and benefits/drawbacks. Glad the course was modeled in a conversational/discussion-based format to allow for free flow of ideas.

-enjoyed learning about the various health systems models, aims, and levers -group project was helpful to apply learning -smaller room would have been a more conducive environment for class discussions

Class is great - provides a great overview about the basic approaches to developing health systems and assessing its success. Con - perhaps Winslow is the wrong space for a class that could become so discussion based. Because we were so spaced out, the class ended up being more of a lecture than a discussion

A great class mostly because Chima is very passionate and thorough in examining how health care systems form. The first half is fairly straightforward, but after the midterm, it's more fun because it's more or less a few weeks of discussion and debate about questions with no correct answer in how countries should handle health care problems.
Love Chima

This is one of the best courses I've taken at YSPH. The material was incredibly interesting and relevant. Each class had interesting discussions. It would have been helpful to have a little more direction for the data assignment.
Lectures and readings were interesting and useful, but the discussions and class exercises could be better thought out.
Very interesting course presented in an engaging way through the intructors style. He made it a very enjoyable lecture that I felt I learned a lot from. Very interactive with the students.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Chima is an effective instructor, though sometimes goes through the material rather quickly.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Knowledgeable, engaging, good facilitator of class discussion and devil's advocate

Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Chima is one of the best professors I've had. He is charismatic and passionate and really included important issues, such as equity, into the course, which was refreshing and I think more professors need to follow his lead. I really really respond well to his teaching style, I have not seen another professor able to engage the entire room in Winslow the way he does and he made it a discussion more than a lecture.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Great professor who knows the topic well and facilitates conversation.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Strengths: The professor is awesome! he has a great sense of humor and makes the class very interactive. Weaknesses: NONE
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Chima was an engaging professor and pushed us to think beyond health care issues at face value.

Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Chima is accessible, very knowledgeable and allows you to explore your thoughts while in the class. Sometimes it felt like the material was rushed, but there is so much to learn in not a lot of time
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Awesome professor. Genuinely interested in having discussions with the class while attempting to solve complex policy issues. Engaging and passionate about the subject.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Great Chima is personable and brilliant and really values student engagement.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Pretty good
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Great professor and friend

Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Chima is fantastic. He's so dedicated to his students and clearly excited to be teaching. He does an amazing job of presenting difficult information in an accessible way. He made each class interactive with probing questions about the course content.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  The professor is truly incredible at fostering critical discussion in the classroom.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Chima is funny and engaging. My only feedback is that sometimes I'm not sure if we are supposed to respond to his seemingly rhetorical questions.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Awesome instructor, one of the best. Very much there for the students and challenges us to dig deeper. Very much enjoyed his style and demeanor.
Instructor: Chimaeze Ndumele  Fantastic! Wish I could've taken more classes with Chima.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course in interesting and enjoyable. I would recommend it overall.
Anyone interested in health systems should take this class, it's one of the best at YSPH!

Although the presentation of the material got a bit redundant towards the end of the semester, it was an easy course that provided a good general understanding of the inner workings of health systems.
Great way to learn about health systems
One of the best YSPH classes!

A great course at the development and challenges of health care systems across the globe. The course is not quite as lofty as Chima seems to imply on the first day, but definitely gives a comprehensive look at what should be considered when thinking about health care, health care systems, and health care reforms.
Good course, take it if you can
Chima is the man.
I highly recommend this course. Chima is one of the best professors and the course material is very interesting.
I learned so much about health systems and how hard it is to change! Highly recommended.
Take it. Provides students with good background on international health systems and how they function. Instructor is very engaging and willing to help. Fun class to be a part of.
